alert.note: Alert for Eastern Montgomery; Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 1:46PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Montgomery and northeastern Chester Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 146 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Trappe, or 17 miles north of West Chester, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pottstown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Collegeville, Royersford, Trappe, Schwenksville, Green Lane, Spring Mount, Valley Forge, Gilbertsville, Skippack, Spring City, North Wales, Harleysville, Pottsgrove, South Pottstown and Evansburg. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 25 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Montgomery; Western Chester; Western Montgomery
